page.title: 20The Railway in Hope
page.content: In the mid 19th century the railway came to Hope.The{north-south double {track}links{Shrewsbury & Hereford.Twin {bore tunnels}at Hope village pass {under Dinmore Hill.}Two ventilation shafts emerge among the trees at the top of that hill. The line cuts Hope completely in half.In 1985 the{line}is quite{well used}by{passenger & goods {trains.}One track has{northbound trains,the other{southbound}trains.Due to very heavy goods trains,repairs are always being made to the track.{South {bound}track uses the old{short length {rails}& makes{trains}very{noisy.North {bound}track uses modern{long length {rails}& makes{trains quieter.}All B.R. trains are hauled by diesel power.Most {locomotives are 1960's vintage.}Now & again{steam engines}travel the line for{enthusiasts}to{admire.}On average {26 trains}per day go in{each direction
